revised_title: Investigating the Presence of Specific Bacteria in Ventilating Pipes, Drains, Inspection Chambers, and Sewers
tldr: The authors conducted a series of experiments to determine the conditions under which specific bacteria from sewage can be present in the air of ventilating pipes, drains, inspection chambers, and sewers. They found that bacteria can be carried by currents of air passing through pipes and that bubbles rising through stagnant water can eject bacteria into the air.
